 2.4 - NAVIGABLE
FOCUS VISIBLE (ENHANCED)(LEVEL AA)
On accessible websites...

[New]

When a User Interface Component displays a visible keyboard focus, all of the
following are true:

 * Minimum area: The focus indication area is greater than or equal to the
   longest side of the bounding rectangle of the focused control, times 2 CSS
   pixels.
 * Focus contrast: Color changes used to indicate focus have at least a 3:1
   contrast ratio with the colors changed from the unfocused control.
 * Contrast or thickness: The focus indication area has a 3:1 contrast ratio
   against all adjacent colors for the minimum area or greater, or has a
   thickness of at least 2 CSS pixels.

These websites...

Provide ways to help users navigate, find content, and determine where they are.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
When links receive focus, an outline is displayed around the link that contrasts
with the background adjacent to the link. I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/focus-visible-enhanced.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 21 May 2021 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2021/WD-WCAG22-20210521/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
